title: FCC directing more satellite constellations to mitigate effects on astronomy
summary: The FCC updated licenses for Iceye and Planet to include provisions requiring coordination with the National Science Foundation (NSF) to mitigate the impact of their satellites on ground-based astronomy. The article discusses regulatory measures and collaborations between satellite operators and astronomers to address concerns about satellite constellations interfering with astronomy.
why_it_matters: The article highlights regulatory actions and industry collaboration to address the impact of satellite constellations on astronomy, but does not describe a concrete business deal involving ICEYE or other entities.
